alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Gilchrist, west central Bradford, western Alachua, southwestern Union and south central Columbia Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alachua, or 11 miles northwest of Gainesville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Worthington Spring, Alachua, High Springs, Worthington Springs, University Of Florida, Groves, Providence, Upland Pines and Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua
